St. Romo is gaining a large popular following in Mexico and the United States. He is the saint that immigrants frequently pray to when they plan to cross - often illegally - into the United States.

Saint Romo at his funeral after being shot during the Cristeros War in the 1920s. He is considered a saint for those who plan to cross into the United States and while his base of worship is in Jalisco, Mexico he has gathered a large following throughout Mexico and the United States.
Prayer cards are popular among the Catholic faithful. This one of St. Romo has his image on one side an a "prayer for the immigrant" on the other.
